Package ca.ualberta.ridr

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ACallback
    Created by Justin on 2016-11-11.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AcceptDriverView
    This view displays a profile of a possible driver for a request, the user can click the contact info of the driver and will be taken to appropriate apps to deal with contacting the driver, the user can also accept the driver and create a ride.
    AcceptRiderView
    This view displays a request object from a drivers perspective, on top of a google maps view of the ride.
    AccountController
    Created by Justin on 2016-11-24.
    AddDriverView
    Add Driver view Created by Justin Barclay Nov 22, 2016, modified code from Storm's AddRiderView This activity displays the add Driver screen, and handles the text input logic, and parsing of data.
    AddRiderView
    Modified by nkaefer on 2016/11/08, further modified by Justin Nov 24, 2016 This activity displays the add user screen, and handles the text input logic, and parsing of data.
    AsyncController
    Created by Justin on 2016-11-10.
    AsyncDatabaseController
    Created by mackenzie on 09/11/16.
    DateSelector
    fragment that allows the user to chose a date from a calender sets the text in a text view to a date of the format dd/MM/yyyy
    Driver
    Created by mackenzie on 12/10/16.
    DriverController
    Created by jferris on 22/10/16.
    DriverRequestsView
    This view displays requests when logged in as a Driver.
    DriverRidesView
    This is the view that shows all of the rides that the Driver is fulfilling.
    EditProfileView
    This is the view that is called when a user profile would like to be edited.
    GeoView
    This view shows all requests by default, and then upon user input shows the user all requests centered around the input in a 2km radius
    LoginView
    Modified by nkaefer on 2016/11/08, Modified by Jusitn on November 24, 2016 This activity displays the login screen, and handles the logic of logging in as a rider or a driver.
    OfflineSingleton
    A singleton to store the things that need to be done once back online
    ProfileView
    This view displays the info of the user when a username was presented and clicked on one note is that the user in prev activity could have been either a rider or a driver and each has specific info , so we will need to have their type passed to us.
    Request
    This is a request object, which is when a Rider makes a request for somebody to drive them somewhere.
    RequestAdapter
    Created by jferris on 13/11/16.
    RequestController
    This controller controls access to all requests used by a view This controllers uses threads to asynchronously perform network requests It then uses a callback interface to inform the view that is using the controller that data has been updated
    Ride
    Created by mackenzie on 12/10/16.
    RideAdapter
    Created by Justin Barclay on 20/11/16.
    RideController
    Created by jferris on 22/10/16, modified by Justin Barclay This is a controller for the rides object that can fetch rides from the server Store them in an array and modify rides and store them on the server
    Rider
    Created by jferris on 22/10/16.
    RiderController
    Created by jferris on 22/10/16.
    RiderMainView
    This view allows for a rider to create a new request.
    RiderRequestView
    The RiderRequestView displays a list of active requests for a logged in rider
    RiderRidesView
    This is the view that shows all of the rides that the Driver is fulfilling.
    RideView
    This view shows all requests by default, and then upon user input shows the user all requests centered around the input in a 2km radius
    SearchResultsView
    The view that shows keyword search results for a driver Also allows new keyword searches to be performed.
    TimeSelector
    fragment that allows the user to chose a time from a clock sets the text in a text view to a time of hh:mm am/pm
    User
    Created by mackenzie on 12/10/16.
